alert.note: Alert for Muskogee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 16 at 2:41AM CDT until April 16 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN HASKELL...SOUTHWESTERN SEQUOYAH AND SOUTHEASTERN MUSKOGEE COUNTIES... At 241 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 6 miles west of Tamaha, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations in or near the path include... Stigler... Porum... Webbers Falls... Keota... Tamaha... Briartown... Kanima... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 285 and 290. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
